channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Flash Floods Sweep Part of Long Island
item.description: Floods swept Long Island early Monday, briefly closing highways. The same storm system dumped as much as 10 inches of rain on Connecticut a day earlier.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Blinken Says Talks Are ‘Maybe the Last’ Chance for Gaza Cease-Fire
item.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken, who was meeting with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Monday, said recent negotiations had created room for a cease-fire and hostage release.

item.title: Palantir boss Alex Karp hires people in less than 2 minutes and personally interviews applicants
item.description: When hiring, Palantir CEO Alex Karp wants to "feel like I’m in the presence of talent.”

item.title: Kamala Harris’s Muscular Patriotism
item.description: In recent weeks, the vice president’s message has revolved around progressive patriotism.

item.title: Ukraine Says Its Incursion Will Bring Peace. Putin’s Plans May Differ.
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky wants to hold Russian territory as leverage in future talks. In Moscow, many doubt the strategy.

item.title: The era of ‘invented in California, made in China’ is over, warns Singapore’s prime minister
item.description: Beijing is “convinced that America is seeking to contain it and suppress its rise,” PM Lawrence Wong argued on Sunday.

item.title: A History of the Chicago DNC Protests in 1968
item.description: When Democrats met that year, the violence that erupted between protesters and the police shook the nation. Here are memories of some of the people who lived it.

item.title: 1 Dead and 6 Missing After Yacht Sinks Off Sicily
item.description: Fifteen people have been rescued after the ship went down in a storm, and expert divers were called in given the depth of the operation.

item.title: Why high food prices can be good news for shoppers—the Swiss farming paradox explained
item.description: The result is that crops such as cherry tomatoes are usually cheaper when they’re out of season.

item.title: Protesters Are Converging on Chicago. City Leaders Say They’re Prepared.
item.description: Activists are pushing for policy changes on Gaza as Democrats hold their convention. Chicago officials are confident they will avoid a repeat of the chaos that unfolded in 1968.

item.title: Survivors of Doomsday Starvation Cult Testify Against Pastor and 93 Associates
item.description: An evangelical pastor in Kenya ordered his flock to shun education and medicine and starve their children to death in order to meet Jesus, witnesses in a manslaughter trial said.

item.title: Dortmund reports highest revenue in club history—just a few months after the sale of English midfielder Jude Bellingham
item.description: Bundesliga side Borussia Dortmund generated 509.1 million euros ($559 million) last season.

item.title: Democrats’ Unity Convention Has One Giant Exception: The Gaza War
item.description: Harris campaign officials and Democratic leaders have stepped up outreach to Arab and Jewish voters before the event, but large protests are still expected.

item.title: The Mennonites Making the Amazon Their Home
item.description: Groups of Mennonites, seeking inexpensive land far from modern life, are carving out new colonies in the Amazon. They are also raising fears that they are adding to the deforestation of the vital jungle.

item.title: DeSantis strategist who pushed for the disastrous Twitter campaign launch is now working with Elon Musk to help elect Donald Trump
item.description: Generra Peck and Elon Musk are working together again on a super political action committee, America PAC, dedicated to electing Donald Trump.
